folder: Hollywood Avenue & Schurz Avenue, Bronx, NY
text:
Hollywood Avenue, east side, between Schurz Avenue and the East River, directly within the grounds of the Silver Beach private real estate development, showing the Robert House. It was built by the founder of Robert College, Constantinople. It is now (1937) known as the Cooper House, after James Fenimore Cooper, the renowned author, who lived and worked here on some of his books. The house is still inhabited and is said, by its present owner, to be about 170 years old.
1906
Gift of Randall Comfort

folder: Hollywood Avenue & Schurz Avenue, Bronx, NY
text:
Hollywood Ave., east side, between Schurz Ave. and the East River (directly within the grounds of the Silver Beach private real estate development), showing the Robert House. It was built by the founder of Robert College, Constantinople. It is also called the James Fenimore Cooper House, after the renowned author who lived and worked here for a number of years. The house is still (1938) inhabited and is said, by its present owner, to be about 170 years old. The view shows the house after it has been renovated.

June 1926.

Brown Brothers.

folder: Hollywood Avenue & Schurz Avenue, Bronx, NY
text:
Hollywood Avenue, east side, from Schurz to Harding Avenues, showing the St. Frances De Chantal Roman Catholic Church.

August 15, 1940
Views 1,2

P. L. Sperr

folder: Hollywood Avenue & Schurz Avenue, Bronx, NY
text:
Hollywood Avenue, east side, from Schurz to Harding Avenues, showing the St. Frances De Chantal Roman Catholic Church.

August 15, 1940

P. L. Sperr

Bronx-Whitestone Bridge: Two views of the $18,000,000 suspension bridge, fourth longest in the world, connecting Old Ferry Point, Bronx, and Whitestone, Queens. View 1 is southwestward from Hollywood and Schurz Avenues; view 2, north from and across Clason Point, both in the Bronx. For additional information see "The New York Times," April 30, 1939.

View 1: August 15, 1940
View 2: August 21, 1940

P. L. Sperr
title: Bridges - Bronx-Whitestone Bridge - [Old Ferry Point, Bronx - Whitestone, Queens.]
